description:
High school student Takumi Fujiwara works as a gas station attendant during the day and a delivery boy for his father's tofu shop early in the morning. Little does he know that his precise driving skills and his father's modified Toyota Sprinter AE86 Trueno make him the best amateur road racer on Mt. Akina's highway. Because of this, racing groups from all over the Gunma prefecture issue challenges to Takumi to see if he really has what it takes to be a road legend.

(Source: Anime News Network)

node.description:
Shuichi Shigeno is a Japanese manga artist famous for creating Initial D. Shigeno has also created Baribari Densetsu, Dopkan, and Tunnel Nuketara Sky Blue all prior to the manga that would make him famous in 1995. In 1985, he received the Kodansha Manga Award in shounen for Bari Bari Densetsu.

He owns a 1980s Toyota Sprinter Trueno with a panda white color scheme, like Initial D's main character Takumi. He also owns a Sonic Blue Mica-colored 1999 WRX Type STi Version 6 with an STi sports bumper (a part from the STi sport catalogue made to look like the 22B STi bumper but fits non-wide body Imprezas) just like Takumi's father, Bunta. One of his notable students is Jyoji Morikawa, creator of Hajime no Ippo.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

He is the son of Mark and Carol Sinclair and the brother of Lauren and Graham Sinclair.

__Awards:__
- Voice Actor of the Year at 2nd Annual BTVA Anime Dub Awards (People's Choice)

He made his debut as an animator on the show [Big X](https://anilist.co/anime/9613/), and joined Mushi Production working there as a director. Around 1975, he began working at Sanrio, which was just moving into the anime market, and wound up staying there for over a decade, going on to direct several of Sanrio's full-length theatrical features such as [Chirin no Suzu](https://anilist.co/anime/2199/), [Sirius no Densetsu](https://anilist.co/anime/2029/) and [Yousei Florence](https://anilist.co/anime/4943/).

He has been working as a freelancer since the breakup of Sanrio's animation department in 1985 following the release of the film Yousei Florence, directing and storyboarding for TV series and movies at various studios.

He made his debut as an animator on the show [Big X](https://anilist.co/anime/9613/), and joined Mushi Production working there as a director. Around 1975, he began working at Sanrio, which was just moving into the anime market, and wound up staying there for over a decade, going on to direct several of Sanrio's full-length theatrical features such as [Chirin no Suzu](https://anilist.co/anime/2199/), [Sirius no Densetsu](https://anilist.co/anime/2029/) and [Yousei Florence](https://anilist.co/anime/4943/).

He has been working as a freelancer since the breakup of Sanrio's animation department in 1985 following the release of the film Yousei Florence, directing and storyboarding for TV series and movies at various studios.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jokerendcard)

Itazu joined [Studio Gallop](https://anilist.co/studio/36/) in 1998 at the young age of 18. Five years later he started a collaboration with studio [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Here he was involved in the production of the TV series [Paranoia Agent](https://anilist.co/anime/323/), which put him in touch with director [Satoshi Kon](https://anilist.co/staff/99580/). After his outstanding performance in the series [Dennou Coil](https://anilist.co/anime/2164/) as a chief animation director, Kon invited him aboard the production of [The Dream Machine](https://anilist.co/anime/6585/) as character designer and chief animation director, but the project was sadly suspended when Kon passed away in 2010. Itazu eventually got to make his debut as a character designer on [Miss Hokusai](https://anilist.co/anime/20709/).

Dave Rodgers is an Italian songwriter, composer, and producer.

Dave Rodgers, considered by many as the "father of Eurobeat", wrote and produced over 2500 songs for many famous artists, like the J-POP singer [Namie Amuro](https://anilist.co/staff/101167/Namie-Amuro) ( Try Me, Watashi Shinjite), [V6](https://anilist.co/staff/168540/V6) ( Ultraman Tiga, Take me higher), [Max](https://anilist.co/staff/285959/MAX) and many others.

A handful of these songs are used in the Initial D anime and video games. He's also apart of the Eurobeat group [The Spiders From Mars](https://anilist.co/staff/277077/The-Spiders-From-Mars). He was married to [Alessandra Mirka Gatti](https://anilist.co/staff/321715) with whom he had one son, [Federico Pasquini](https://anilist.co/staff/321713).

Davide Di Marcantonio is an Italian Eurobeat artist.

He is the owner of Dima Music, as well as one of the founders of Eurobeat Masters.

[Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michiko_Neya) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%A0%B9%E8%B0%B7%E7%BE%8E%E6%99%BA%E5%AD%90)

Michiko Neya is a Japanese voice actress. She formerly worked at Arts Vision but is now a freelancer.

Non-anime roles:~!
• Ami Barklight in "Tales of Phantasia -Full Voice Edition-" (VG)
• Cindy Campbell (voiceover for Anna Faris) in "Scary Movie" (live-action movie)
• Ellie in "Magic School Lunar!" (VG)
• Emeraldas in "Xenogears" (VG)
• Emma Hetfield in "Wild Arms Alter Code: F" (VG)
• Hibiki (Sekirei No.12) in "Sekirei" (drama CD)
• Hsien-Ko / Lei-Lei in "Darkstalkers II" (VG)
• Hsien-Ko / Lei-Lei in "Darkstalkers III" (VG)
• Kira in "The Power of the Dark Crystal" (2008 movie)
• Lei Lei in "Namco X Capcom" (VG)
• Linda Zakroid in "Mitsumete Knight R Daibouken hen" (VG)
• Linda Zakroid in "Mitsumete Knight" (VG)
• Mako Sato in "Initial D: Special Stage" (VG)
• Maria Traydor in "Star Ocean : Till the End of Time" (VG)
• Martina Martinez in "Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th" (live-action movie)
• Natalia L. K. Lanvaldear in "Tales of the Abyss" (VG)
• Ouka Nagisa in "Super Robot Wars Original Generations" (VG/PS2)
• Rose in "Namco X Capcom" (VG)
• Rose in "Street Fighter Alpha 2" (VG)
• Rose in "Street Fighter Alpha 3" (VG)
• Rose in "Street Fighter Alpha" (VG)
• Sato Mako in "Initial D Kuroi Inazuma: Aratanaru Fuhai Densetsu " (Drama CD)
• Sato Mako in "Initial D: Impact Blue no Kanata ni..." (Drama CD)
• Sato Mako in "Initial D" (VG)
• Seana in "Elemental Gearbolt" (VG)
• Sidney Prescott (voiceover for Neve Campbell) in "Scream series" (live-action movies)
• Sophitia Alexandra in "Soul Calibur 2" (VG)
• Sophitia Alexandra in "Soul Calibur 3" (VG)
• Sophitia Alexandra in "Soul Edge" (VG)
!~

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Kula Diamond in _King of Fighters_ game series
Katsumata Ryuuichi is a music composer and arranger. He was also keyboarder in the band Kome Kome Club (米米CLUB).
